description: Creates a new Neptune ML model training job. See Model training using the modeltraining command. When invoking this operation in a Neptune cluster that has IAM authentication enabled, the IAM user or role making the request must have a policy attached that allows the neptune-db:StartMLModelTrainingJob IAM action in that cluster.

parameters.name: dataProcessingJobId
parameters.description: The job ID of the completed data-processing job that has created the data that the training will work with.

parameters.name: trainModelS3Location
parameters.description: The location in Amazon S3 where the model artifacts are to be stored.

parameters.name: subnets
parameters.description: The IDs of the subnets in the Neptune VPC. The default is None. (string) ---

parameters.name: securityGroupIds
parameters.description: The VPC security group IDs. The default is None. (string) ---

parameters.name: customModelTrainingParameters
parameters.description: The configuration for custom model training. This is a JSON object. The path to the Amazon S3 location where the Python module implementing your model is located. This must point to a valid existing Amazon S3 location that contains, at a minimum, a training script, a transform script, and a model-hpo-configuration.json file. trainingEntryPointScript (string) --- The name of the entry point in your module of a script that performs model training and takes hyperparameters as command-line arguments, including fixed hyperparameters. The default is training.py. transformEntryPointScript (string) --- The name of the entry point in your module of a script that should be run after the best model from the hyperparameter search has been identified, to compute the model artifacts necessary for model deployment. It should be able to run with no command-line arguments.The default is transform.py.

nested_params.name: sourceS3DirectoryPath
nested_params.description: The path to the Amazon S3 location where the Python module implementing your model is located. This must point to a valid existing Amazon S3 location that contains, at a minimum, a training script, a transform script, and a model-hpo-configuration.json file.

nested_params.name: trainingEntryPointScript
nested_params.description: The name of the entry point in your module of a script that performs model training and takes hyperparameters as command-line arguments, including fixed hyperparameters. The default is training.py.

nested_params.name: transformEntryPointScript
nested_params.description: The name of the entry point in your module of a script that should be run after the best model from the hyperparameter search has been identified, to compute the model artifacts necessary for model deployment. It should be able to run with no command-line arguments.The default is transform.py.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the new model training job.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the new model training job.

nested_items.name: creationTimeInMillis
nested_items.description: The model training job creation time, in milliseconds.
